forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 59 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 8 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind 7 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco with a soft, muted light, hinting at the day ahead. A veil of clouds lingers just overhead, offering a cool embrace that contrasts with the city's vibrance. The forecast suggests a 50% chance of rain, and as the hours slip by, one might sense the moisture in the air, a whisper of the wetness to come. The temperatures flirt with the low sixties, dipping slightly as the afternoon approaches, beckoning those who venture outside to dress in layers—light jackets and perhaps a well-loved scarf will serve well against the stirring southwest winds.

As the morning unfolds, the clouds keep the sun at bay, ensuring that the day retains a partially sunny disposition punctuated by moments of elusive brightness. A stroll along the Embarcadero might invite a touch of chill, yet offers rich opportunities to enjoy the sweeping waterfront views. For those who crave a quieter engagement with the city, a visit to one of the local cafes, preferably one with a window seat, allows the soul to contemplate the passing scene. Should the clouds thicken and release their burden later in the evening, one could retreat indoors, folding into the warmth of a soft chair, perhaps with a book or a glass of wine, as the world beyond remains soothingly draped in gray.
